alert.note: Alert for Choctaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 30 at 9:18PM CDT until March 30 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR CHOCTAW...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON AND NORTHWESTERN CLARKE COUNTIES... At 917 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Jefferson to 4 miles west of Putnam to 5 miles east of Silas, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Butler, Lisman, Silas, Coffeeville, Pennington, Gilbertown and Toxey. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for southwestern Alabama. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
